articles.headline: Fallen Bodies, Jet Parts and a Child’s Pink Book
articles.snippet: Local residents and rescue workers saw smoldering debris litter miles of sparsely populated Ukrainian farmland after Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 crashed.
articles.abstract: Local residents and rescue workers saw smoldering debris litter miles of sparsely populated Ukrainian farmland after Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 crashed.
articles.lead_paragraph: GRABOVO, Ukraine — Incongruously, given that the plane fell from more than 30,000 feet, many of the bodies strewn about in the smoldering wreckage of Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 were largely intact. A woman in a black sweater lay on her back, blood streaming from her face, her left arm raised as if signaling someone. Another victim, naked except for a black bra, lay on the field, her gray hair mixing with the green grass, one leg broken and her body torn.

articles.headline: Citigroup’s Settlement, Pro and Con
articles.snippet: The $7 billion deal does not compensate affected investors, but it does reimburse the government for some of the indirect costs of the financial crisis.
articles.abstract: The $7 billion deal does not compensate affected investors, but it does reimburse the government for some of the indirect costs of the financial crisis.
articles.lead_paragraph: The punishment did not fit the crime, or at least it did not fit the crime that was charged.

articles.headline: India Aims to Make Forlorn City a Model for Revival
articles.snippet: The new prime minister has promised to tackle Varanasi’s many problems and to turn the downtrodden city into a showcase of culture and small business.
articles.abstract: The new prime minister has promised to tackle Varanasi’s many problems and to turn the downtrodden city into a showcase of culture and small business.
articles.lead_paragraph: VARANASI, India — The big question on many minds here is: How long will the electricity last?

articles.headline: Fox Challenges ESPN With Pursuit of Time Warner
articles.snippet: Purchasing Time Warner would give Fox a robust roster of sports programming, allowing it to command more lucrative fees from cable and satellite companies.
articles.abstract: Purchasing Time Warner would give Fox a robust roster of sports programming, allowing it to command more lucrative fees from cable and satellite companies.
articles.lead_paragraph: Rupert Murdoch loves nothing more than taking on an entrenched powerhouse, and with his audacious $80 billion bid to purchase Time Warner, he showed a willingness to go up against one of the industry’s most powerful players — ESPN.
articles.byline: By Emily Steel and Richard Sandomir

articles.headline: A Push Into Gaza, but the Ground Has Shifted
articles.snippet: The landscape differs from previous battles with Hamas, largely because Israel has framed its operations as an effort to eliminate tunnels used to store weapons or stage attacks.
articles.abstract: The landscape differs from previous battles with Hamas, largely because Israel has framed its operations as an effort to eliminate tunnels used to store weapons or stage attacks.
articles.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — As Israeli troops once again operated inside the Gaza Strip on Friday, the risks of a deep entanglement, a failure to curb the rocket fire, and the condemnation of civilian casualties were all too apparent.

articles.headline: U.S. Sees Evidence of Russian Links to Jet’s Downing
articles.snippet: President Obama pointed to the Kremlin’s role in arming rebels in the area of the attack and referred to the events there as an “outrage of unspeakable proportions.”
articles.abstract: President Obama pointed to the Kremlin’s role in arming rebels in the area of the attack and referred to the events there as an “outrage of unspeakable proportions.”
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The United States government has concluded that the passenger jet felled over Ukraine was shot down by a Russian-made surface-to-air missile launched from rebel-held territory and most likely provided by Russia to pro-Moscow separatists, officials said on Friday.
articles.byline: By Peter Baker, Michael R. Gordon and Mark Mazzetti

articles.headline: The Limits of the Law in Insider Trading
articles.snippet: The case against Rengan Rajaratnam, who was found not guilty, raises questions that have split judges.
articles.abstract: The case against Rengan Rajaratnam, who was found not guilty, raises questions that have split judges.
articles.lead_paragraph: The remarkable winning streak of Preet Bharara, the United States attorney for the Southern District of New York, came to an end a little over a week ago when Rengan Rajaratnam, the younger brother of the convicted hedge fund operator Raj Rajaratnam, was acquitted of one count of conspiracy to commit securities fraud. That leaves Mr. Bharara with a still-remarkable 85-1 record in insider trading cases. But that one loss deserves an asterisk.
